channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Impassable Walkway (ongoing), 14th September
item.description:
The walkway by this road junction has been dug up and left totally impassable for an unreasonable amount of time (since at least June 2025 based on other reports) with no remedial action. This is a danger to pedestrians who have to enter the roadway unnecessarily; the roadway is by a road junction and is a busy bus and general vehicle route. It is also unacceptable, through serious lack of action over many months, to endanger those with accessibility issues, pushchairs and other extenuating circumstances to be put at risk.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Cameron Road, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip, 14th September
item.description:
Black bag and large garden umbrella dumped between containers this is a continually recurring situation so suspect someone local with easy access to the park in the evening ( There was also some rubbish left after an event which did not get picked up by the contractor and had been spread by animals- this was dealt with by the friends group this afternoon)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southlands Road, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Japanese knotweed regrown, 14th September
item.description:
The previously reported Japanese knotweed in the planters next to pavement at 2 Cervantes Court, Inverness Terrace, have regrown, and should be destroyed before they grow into pavement and spread to Hallfield Estate and School

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cervantes Court, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter and broken glass and gas canisters, 14th September
item.description:
This part of the road is full of litter, glass, gas canisters. The bushes are very over grown and no lighting causing this location to be a hotspot for cars turning up late at night, persons urinating, hanging out drinking and inhaling gas balloons and the person living in the white transit van that has been parked there for months. I feel very uneasy as a women walking past here in the dark.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Scotsdale Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Have seen 2 rats around the bin area, 14th September
item.description:
Every week this bin area gets over loaded with rubbish. The rubbish bags are exposed so the foxes rip them open and cause food waste to be spread sometimes blocking the pathway. Yesterday, I spotted a rat and today I saw 2 of them. Sort it out!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Enfield Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Replacement sign required, 14th September
item.description:
Hello, I rent garage number 5 (Marcon Court, E8 1LN) from the London Borough of Hackney. The "Keep Clear at All Times" sign that used to be on the door of the garage has fallen off and is missing - see photos. Please replace. Many thanks.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Amhurst Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish. AGAINa, 14th September
item.description:
Dumped rubbish. Again. You are doing nothing to stop it. Wasting our taxes on sorting this out on a weekly basis. When you should be sorting the culprit out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Main Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
